If anyone hasn't had the pleasure of playing this game yet, well they should!
It's a really fun 3rd person shooter with tons of action and slow mo fire fights.
Backing up the great gameplay with a twisted story, easter eggs and some humurous mis-haps, this game is close to perfect.
So what might the cons be? Well, when you bullet time dodge, you can't shoot on the ground so you have to wait for Max to get back up before you can fire another shot which by then may be too late.
Another con (and this is mostly because of me) is there are no real checkpoints within a level which means unless you remember to quick-save (which I don't half the time) you'll end up back at the beginning of the level.
The last and final con is that Maxy seems to have 2 left feet and doesn't like to run in a straight line. Which wouldn't be an issue but there are a few simple platforming obstacles in the game that are more difficult than what they seem because it's pretty hard to calculate Max's jump range and his 2 left feet that seem to jump diagonally at the worst times.
Definitely do get this game because there's a lot more good than bad.

This is one of those special-place-in-my-heart games that elicits some kind of catharsis every time it's played.  The setting, gameplay, soundtrack, dialogue, artwork - it all comes together in this strange culmination of dark justice.   Max Payne loses in the end, whether he wins or not.  He's doomed from the start, and a lot of games don't torture their heroes this much.  So from the beginning you're in this nothing-to-lose mentality alongside our protagonist.  The mechanics even support this idea, as you can restart from the last point of death if you mash the quicksave button like an underlying arc from a Lost episode.  Events replay like you went back in time a few seconds prior to your blundered encounter and decided to duck left instead of right.  The gaming community criticized this feature when it released all those years ago, and people are still kind of iffy on it because of its linear drive.  This game really is a comic come to life.  The setting is as much a character as Max is, rife with loneliness and torment - slowly picked apart by what can only be described as a 100-year winter.  New York City is the target of the Norse Gods' ♥♥♥♥-this-place-in-particular" ice beam of misery
date: effectively isolating Max and a thousand goons to do glorious battle in Thunderdome 2.0.  The reason this game is and will always be timeless is because you don't need to inject yourself into 2001 to appreciate this title for all that it is.  It's a story that can be told over and over."

Despite its age, Max Payne remains a fun shooter with an interesting story. The game suffers, however, from some clunkiness because of when it was made and its attempts to have occasional platforming sections, that are sometimes frustrating and irritating to play. Some of them are important to the story, but could've been done without having the player make precise jumps with imprecise movement controls. There were also frequent stutters in cutscenes and keyboard lock-ups when I played (Max would be stuck in place or stuck moving or diving in one direction). Despite some of the minor issues, the game holds up because of good encounter design, fun shooting mechanics and great writing, especially in Max's thoughts. The frequent metaphors and allusions give it an almost literary quality. Recommended, but might feel a little too dated for some.
Despite the massive issue with the sound in cutscenes, this game works pretty smooth and it's quite fun. It's worth your money in my opinion.

reviewText: 아메리칸 드림을 이루려는 LAPD 소속 형사 맥스 페인의 가족이 신종 마약 '발키리'를 먹은 침입자들의 의해 살해당하자 맥스는 복수를 위해 DEA(마약단속국)에 들어가게됩니다.맥스는 흑막을 찾다가 자신의 동료를 살해했다는 누명을 쓰고 뉴욕 시경한테 쫏기게 되고 이 마약을 만든 데에는 원래 미 육군의 병사의 지구력과 반응력 향상을 위한 약이었지만 프로젝트가 취소되서 남은 약들은 뉴욕의 불량배들한테 넘기게 된 것입니다.일단 이 게임은 게임에서 슬로우모션이 얼마나 잘 통하는지 알려주는 기념비적인 게임입니다.E3 1998에서는 적들이 거인이 되는듯 신기한(?)것도 있었습니다.일단 중간에 나오는 컷씬도 상당히 분위기 있고 맘에 들고 무었보다 재미있고 모드도 많기 떄문에 정말 추천하는 게임입니다!

A seminal shooter but one that doesn't quite stand up to modern scrutiny. A few genuinely awful dream sequences and a some serious compatibility issues with Windows 7 and 8 make this a hard sell to someone who doesn't already have an appreciation for Remedy's work, but if you have even a passing interest in Max Payne or the slow-mo heavy Hong Kong action flicks that inspired, then it's worth wading through this steadily decaying classic.

Have you ever watched a good 80s action movie, like Die-Hard? If you like Noir story-telling like the Usual Suspects, you'll love this game. It may be very old, but if you max out the settings, you'll feel like your computer is godly because it's still pushing out >60fps, and it doesn't look that bad for a game of old age.\nIt has a great story that I have only just begun to take in. I'm really excited to go through this series, and you should join me.

never played the game when it first arrived a little over 12 years ago, but i just finished it last night and i'm definitely a fan. i actually started the series with the 3rd game and was curious about the rest of the series. so when i went on sale last week, i picked up the first 2 games. i sat down and played through the first game in about 3 nights and am anxious to start on 2. the story is awesome, as i thought a sam lake story would be. graphically its obviously nowhere close to todays standards but at no point were the graphics taking my mind out of the storyline and gameplay. as far as gameplay goes, we have a game that definitely holds up. basically a fast paced, cover based shooter, without the ability to actually take cover. i mean that in a good way. pretty satisfying seeing 3 people running at you when you're behind a pillar and you shoot dodge out from behind said pillar and kill all 3 with well placed slo mo head shots. i started playing max payne 1 just to see the story in action and ended up really enjoying the gameplay as well.

For a game that's over 10 years old it still holds up really well. Sure some of the graphics will make you laugh, but the story is fantastic and bullet time is pretty much the best thing ever. I think it's safe to say that this game is one of the best games that I have ever played.  It deserves more than an 89/100, in my opinion.  If you like film-noir type action and a story that makes you want to play right through the game in one sitting, then this game is for you.  The entire Max Payne series should be played through at least once, from one avid gamer to another.

I know what you're thinking: the game has aged some, but is it still fun to play today? In short, yes it very much is. The writing may not be as cool as I had remembered it being, and sometimes the graphics look just plain ugly, but the game is undeniably fun, and the story, while silly at times, is something you are going to want to see to the end.

When you buy this game, try to remember that you aren't buying a game. You're buying a graphic novel with a film-noir storyline that you get to interact with somewhat. As long as you keep that in mind, you'll be MUCH happier. The gameplay is pretty straight-forward. Shoot everyone that isn't you while using Max's signature bullet time" mechanic to make sure that you don't get shot back. As you press on through the game world dispensing violence at every turn
hoursPlayed: and revenge unfolds by way of graphic novel pages and superior voice acting.\n\nGive this one a try if you like a good noir story. Give it a pass if you're looking for anything other than that."

Max Payne is an awesomely cinematic game, with some stunning action gameplay that goes both powerfull and very addicting. It has a GREAT story (I can't express in lines how great it truly is) that goes involving and is told in a series of graphic novel sections, narrated by the forever dramatic James McCaffrey doing Max's voice, while lead writter Sam Lake plays the role of Max on screen.\n\nThis game didn't just introduce and literally create the Bullet Time mode on videogames, it's also by far one of the best cinematic games ever made, I got into it expecting only a good Third Person Shooter, but when I finished it I came out with an entirely new appreciation for the Gaming Industry. Max Payne is a Pc classic that deserves to be played by everyone that likes action games, and everyone with a taste for truly cinematic videogames, because Remedy Entertainment achieves an amazing level of interactive story telling, creating a masterpiece that I would, with no doubts, include in my Top best games ever made.

reviewText: After so many years, this game is still a blast to play, very enjoyable. Story is good, artwork and voice acting is stellar, gameplay is precise. No bugs. On moddern OS, you probably need a fix for audio or other incompatibilities.

A rather cinematic game , accompanied by a rare type of storytelling which involves using a comic book strip storyline. The game follows a cop who finds himself in a questionable position after his family is killed and he seeks revenge.

There is a lot of emphasis put on performing as well as possible. Absorbing a few rounds from most guns will kill you so you need to take advantage of cover as much as possible and painkillers (the medkits of Max Payne) are sparse in the levels. Luckily , Max can take full advantage of dolphin dives to move from cover to cover. This proves highly advantageous during parts of the game like in boss battles or where there are many enemies.

Given the game's age , don't expect excellent graphics but looking back on this classic , you will see some features of the game which are well ahead of the time it was made in such as acial expressions and almost ragdoll bodies.

The game did require a small bug-fix relating to the sound ingame which seems to be due to the way that the MP3 files worked on older systems. There is an official fix for this which I believe I found on the Steam forums.

Aside from that , there is very little bad to say about this title. I have only one gripe with the title - there is no way to stay lying down after the dolphin dive. Max will get up as soon as possible from the dolphin dive which resulted in me dying a great number of times. Given the game's quick save and load buttons , however , this very rarely meant repeating whole battles which I am extremely thankful for.

Also there is a villain based on an in-game comic book heroand the game is self-aware. Yep.

Amazing noir, third person shooter. If you're looking for a game with a unique story, characters, writing, and gameplay, this is the one to get.

Over-the-top noir elements blends with classic run-and-gun action to bring us Max Payne, family man turned poetic cynical mass murderer. It's a blast to play, the bullet time ability slows down everything and lets you aim real-time, giving you a crucial advatnage when several bullets lay anyone flat. Watching Max's descent into brokenness is also a rare treat, and it's DONE SO WELL. His cynicism is hilarious and poetic, and he speaks as if condemning himself and the world around him as a hopeless cause. This is noir on steriods. Take notes - this is how you do a brooding badass.

Some severe issues with Modern Systems, especially 64bit OS and ATI products. Go to http://pcgamingwiki.com/wiki/Max_Payne to read the walkthroughs on how to fix.\n\nOther then that still a great game.
Doesn't get any better than this.  All time classic for solo play.
Suprisingly still holds up in gameplay department. Incredibly fun game noir linear shooter. Definetly should buy but know that it does drag towards the end.

How come games don't do dark, drug-filled detective noir often? Because it's so hard to do well in a modern setting!

Max Payne pulls it off with hard core bullet  time action to boot. Tough battles and bosses, painstakingly laid out encounters and while frankly doesn't hold up as well writing-wise as it's sequel the story is still very well laid out in comic-style interludes. It is gritty and holds nothing back.

Play to see how third person games started, since this is by far the best one of the time, and work through to have a rather satisfying game by the end - then button down to play the superior sequel!

Simply one of the best all time video games! It's amazing third person shooter/action game which you'll definitely remember for long time after you'll finish it. An oldie but a goodie, this game is possibly one of the best third-person shooters I've ever played. The neo-noir setting combined with fast-paced, exciting, cinematic gameplay makes for an excellent game. The old game engine and out-dated graphics do little to stand in the way of the fun to be had while playing this game. In short, this is one of the only shooters I've played that actually feels epic and over-the-top, rather than frenzied, frantic, and disorienting.\nPlay it. You won't.

A really great game with a lot of challenge even at easy mode. While some parts can be considered unforgiving and unfair the hard gameplay is countered by bullet time (Slowing time) and save states. This is overall a great game and if you're looking for a bit of a challenge then I definitly reccomend the buy.\n\nMy only complaints with this game is that dual ingrams are a bit too powerful and even with an M4 you can still get outgunned. I also think the hit detection can be a bit wonky but I still love this game.

While it does take a little getting used to, Max Payne eventually becomes a very engrossing game. The grapics haven't aged well, and I found the audio the be very buggy, but somehow the gameplay and story outweighed that for me. The bullet time feature seems ahead of its time, and while the final fight may not amount to much, the ride ofers many thrills. Max Payne kept me playing, and it's sure to keep you playing as well.
They were all dead. The final gunshot was an exclamation mark to everything that had led to this point. I released my finger from the trigger. And then it was over.

reviewText: After so many years, this game is still a blast to play, very enjoyable. Story is good, artwork and voice acting is stellar, gameplay is precise. No bugs. On moddern OS, you probably need a fix for audio or other incompatibilities.
This has to be the best TPS I have ever played, it's full of action with a powerful and intense storyline. The levels are great, you can even slow down time and kill mobsters, what's not to love?
Enjoying the old school Bullet time!
When Max Payne was released in 2001, it was one of the first shooters to have an in-depth, stylized story. To this day, Max Payne still holds up as a grade A product.

there are games with epic storylines. then there is Max Payne.

yes. the storyline is that ♥♥♥♥♥ good. it's a tragic and beautiful story. it's a story about revenge, about redemption, about finding the truth, about love.

the voice acting, the comic strip style cutscene, the gloomy atmosphere, everything just draws you deeper and deeper into the story.

the gameplay is also awesome. third-person Matrix style bullet-time, what more do you want? you will feel like a badass action hero. guaranteed.

absolutely sublime from start to finish.

if you have not played this, buy it NOW. or torrent it. whatever you do, GET IT and play it. you will not regret it. i promise.
Third person shooter masterpiece made in Finland.\nI ask you WHAT THE ♥♥♥♥" if you still haven't played this."
Solid shooting mechanics combine with great writing/story to make a game well worth playing.

Experience the payne from this game, great story and bullet time //uses painkillers\n\nSuch a old classic but holds out well even today , tons of mods  for the game as well but the story and gameplay is one of a kind .

An engaging and modern film noir, Max Payne is a creative and cathartic shooter with one of the better stories I've seen in gaming, and it will have you diving onto your bed making pew-pew" noises when you finish."

Do you like Noir films? Do you like wise cracking protaginists? Do you like the fourth wall being smasehed to bits? Do you like an engrossing stroy that will keep you on the edge of your seat? Well you'll get all this and more from this game! It's a shooty game pewpew bullet time whoosh!

Before I got my computer I had a laptop, a pretty crappy laptop . It couldn't really run much aside from Half-Life and it barely ran Puzzle Quest, barely. I remember hearing that this game made it's way to the PC, so I gave it a go. I must've played for 3 or 4 hours straight. It's fun and action packed, an older classic that should not be passed up on. Buy it, play it, love it.

I played this years ago on the ps2 only to revisit it months ago on pc. It's still an excellent third person shooter with a great level design. The bullet time effects make for some interesting gameplay mechanics as well.

What can I say? Absolutely awesome game! A must buy definitively. It has very decent voice acting, great sondtrack, an interesting grim and noir story with beatifully drawn comic style cutscenes, and most importantly excellent gameplay. The most important feature of the game is Bullet Time where you slow down time around you and kill everything in your way in a spectacular way all while dodging bullets. You're going to do a lot of quick-saving and quick-loading though, because a minor mistake can be fatal, and you will simply die (shotgun ARE insta-kill even on the easiest difficulty).\nI can't really think of other negative aspects of this game other than constant quickloading and it's somewhat repepetive in that nature (go in a room, die, quickload, try to clear out the room with minimal damage taken, etc), so overall, it's definitively a must-buy to any gamer.\n9.5/10
A classic that is timeless. Everyone should play at least once till the end
aw now this baby is rock an roll heavy story bad weather big city we all fell in love with it
This is some dark ♥♥♥ noir greatness wrapped up in a frozen Hobo!!!

Holy ♥♥♥♥ this game was so ♥♥♥♥ing good. MAx Paynes story pulls you in and will have you asking for more till the credits. The only down sides are the V flash back things they take you out of the world imo. The ending is lacking because they knew they were going to make MP2:TFoMP yet it was an amazing game and aged really well. Pick it up on sale for 3$ for both and there is no way in hell you should be disappointed.

I loaded up the game. Loading screens flashed by in an instant, giving a glimpse of the game ahead. Before I knew it, I was shooting at junked-up goons, putting bullets in their shaved skulls. I time traveled back to 2001. Bullet time was a new thing. Everything was good. I had avenged my family.

Holds up pretty well despite being a ten year old game. But it's hard to go back to after playing Max Payne 2. MP2's shooting much more refined and has increased depth. However, I like the noir writing better in Max Payne 1. Worth checking out.
Film noir gaming with a pretty damn fun bullet time mechanic thrown in.  Must-play.
Your wife died. Get over it.

I was foolish enough to ignore this game when it first came out years ago and only bought the double pack last year. What a fool I was, 2001 me would have loved this game.

Set in a snowed in New York in 2001 you play as a Burnt out cop Max Payne who's out for revenge after his wife and newborn child are killed by rampaging drug addicts. Pretty grim stuff eh? well it only gets darker from here on out.

The level design and sound is brilliant, although it has aged I would argue it aged rather well. The atmosphere it gives off is incredibly bleak and noir at its best. The gunplay is great with rounds going off all around you as you fly through the air in slow motion, and yes corpses and bulletcasings (including empty mags and shotgun hulls) stay around. You can really see the carnage you caused. The TV shows playing on random tv sets dotted around the levels are brilliant too, this was continued in Payne II.

Unfortunely for most with modern machines this game will not work from the get go, but there is a series of fixes and widescreen mods floating around on the web. It took me about 5 minutes to get it running on nice resolutions.

In conclusion if you like 3rd person quality shooters that have strong atmosphere and fun gunplay look know further, this game is a classic.
this game was pretty fun i dont remember like the end but i remember that the levels where max was like hallucinating were pretty cool

Fun game. The story is great, as far as being engrossing and unfamiliar, compared to the template of other games. Very linear gameplay. There is NO WAY to play the chapters of this game outside of the set path, so if you like to explore, you will be disappointed. But if you like to play fun games with great stories, then this game will make you happy.

Max Payne is the second best videogame that I have ever played. It has one flaw - there's one moment where the writers break the fourth wall momentarily for a cheap gag. It doesn't last long, nor does it particularly mar the experience either before or after. Aside from that, the game is just about flawless.

A must play game that made shooters what they are today. The graphics and AI are obviously dated considering the game is about 15 years old, but the plot is engaging and the overall gameplay is superb. It needed a quickfix for a bug that didn't utilize multiple cpus well, but thats fairly common amongst games from pre multi cpu processors.
